required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Lipid Biomarker Study in Men With Dyslipidemia After Simvastatin Treatment (Study MK-0000-140)(COMPLETED)
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Placebo Controlled Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Effects of Simvastatin Treatment on Measurements of Lipidomic Biomarkers in Men With Dyslipidemia

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to provide human lipidomics standards with simvastatin treatment that were to be used for comparison with similar preclinical studies.

primary_outcome.measure: Arachidonic Acid Level After 2 Weeks of Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Arachidonic acid level (20:4n6) in the cholesterol ester lipid class. The mean reported was an adjusted mean, which was obtained from running a 2-period crossover model that had fixed treatment and period terms and a random participant term.

secondary_outcome.measure: Fasting Blood Lipidomic Levels After 2 Weeks of Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting blood cholesterol ester, lysophosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylethanolamine, and triacylglycerol levels compared to placebo. The mean reported was an adjusted mean.

secondary_outcome.measure: Serum Proprotein Convertase Subtilisin-like/Kexin Type 9 (PCSK9) Level
secondary_outcome.description: Two days of standardized, pre-packaged meals were provided prior to the 10-hour fast required before blood collection. To assess how consumption of a meal would affect levels of plasma PCSK9, following each of the fasting blood draws, participants were asked to consume a high fat meal (heavy whipping cream + vanilla ice cream in a 1:4 ratio [dose = 162 g/m^2]) within 20 minutes. For the duration of the test, participants were to remain seated or recumbent until blood samples were drawn 4 h after meal completion. The mean reported was an adjusted mean (defined in first outcome measure).
Change in blood linoleic acid levels for Cholesterol Ester compared to placebo.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Fasting Delta 5 Desaturase Enzyme Activity Compared to Placebo
secondary_outcome.description: Change in fasting delta 5 desaturase enzyme activity compared to placebo. Delta 5 desaturase enzyme activity is defined as the ratios of C20:4n-6 to C20:3n-6 and C20:5n-3 to C20:4n-3.

arm_group.description: Simvastatin 40 mg tablets once daily for 2 weeks followed by placebo for 2 weeks

arm_group.arm_group_label: Placebo first, then simvastatin 40 mg once daily
arm_group.description: Placebo for 2 weeks followed by simvastatin 40 mg once daily for 2 weeks

intervention.arm_group_label: Placebo first, then simvastatin 40 mg once daily

intervention.description: Placebo, matching the simvastatin (40 mg) tablet as a single oral daily dose for 2 weeks
intervention.arm_group_label: Placebo first, then simvastatin 40 mg once daily

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participant is a Caucasian (including Hispanic) male
- Participant has a maximum waist size of 40 inches
- Participant does not currently use any lipid-altering medications
- Participant is in good health other than the diagnosis of dyslipidemia
Exclusion Criteria:
- Participant has had stomach ulcers within the last 3 months
- Participant has had a heart attack in the last 6 months or has angina
- Participant has chronic heart failure
- Participant has a history of stroke, seizures, or major neurological disorder
- Participant has a history of cancer
- Participant has a gastrointestinal condition that affects bowel movements
- Participant has type 1 or 2 diabetes

group.title: Simvastatin 40 mg, Then Placebo
group.description: Simvastatin 40 mg once daily for 2 weeks followed by placebo once daily for 2 weeks

group.title: Placebo First, Then Simvastatin 40 mg
group.description: Placebo once daily for 2 weeks followed by simvastatin 40 mg daily for 2 weeks

outcome.title: Arachidonic Acid Level After 2 Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: Arachidonic acid level (20:4n6) in the cholesterol ester lipid class. The mean reported was an adjusted mean, which was obtained from running a 2-period crossover model that had fixed treatment and period terms and a random participant term.
outcome.population: Only participants with complete arachidonic acid data were included.

group.title: Simvastatin 40 mg
group.description: Simvastatin 40 mg once daily for 2 weeks followed by placebo once daily for 2 weeks

group.title: Placebo
group.description: Placebo once daily for 2 weeks followed by simvastatin 40 mg daily for 2 weeks

measure.title: Arachidonic Acid Level After 2 Weeks of Treatment
measure.description: Arachidonic acid level (20:4n6) in the cholesterol ester lipid class. The mean reported was an adjusted mean, which was obtained from running a 2-period crossover model that had fixed treatment and period terms and a random participant term.
measure.population: Only participants with complete arachidonic acid data were included.

analysis.p_value_desc: Endpoint was analyzed as appropriate for a 2-period crossover model using a mixed model with fixed terms of period and treatment with participants as a random factor.
analysis.method_desc: An unstructured covariance and Kenward Roger degrees of freedom were assumed.

outcome.title: Fasting Blood Lipidomic Levels After 2 Weeks of Treatment
outcome.description: Change in fasting blood cholesterol ester, lysophosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylethanolamine, and triacylglycerol levels compared to placebo. The mean reported was an adjusted mean.
outcome.population: Only participants with complete blood lipidomic data were included. For cholesterol ester 22:5n6, n=26 for the simvastatin arm and n=27 for the placebo arm.

group.description: Simvastatin 40 mg once daily for 2 weeks followed by placebo for 2 weeks

group.description: Placebo once daily for 2 weeks followed by Simvastatin 40 mg once daily for 2 weeks

measure.title: Fasting Blood Lipidomic Levels After 2 Weeks of Treatment
measure.description: Change in fasting blood cholesterol ester, lysophosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylcholine, phosphatidylethanolamine, and triacylglycerol levels compared to placebo. The mean reported was an adjusted mean.
measure.population: Only participants with complete blood lipidomic data were included. For cholesterol ester 22:5n6, n=26 for the simvastatin arm and n=27 for the placebo arm.

outcome.title: Serum Proprotein Convertase Subtilisin-like/Kexin Type 9 (PCSK9) Level
outcome.description: Two days of standardized, pre-packaged meals were provided prior to the 10-hour fast required before blood collection. To assess how consumption of a meal would affect levels of plasma PCSK9, following each of the fasting blood draws, participants were asked to consume a high fat meal (heavy whipping cream + vanilla ice cream in a 1:4 ratio [dose = 162 g/m^2]) within 20 minutes. For the duration of the test, participants were to remain seated or recumbent until blood samples were drawn 4 h after meal completion. The mean reported was an adjusted mean (defined in first outcome measure).
outcome.population: Only participants with complete PCSK9 data were included.

measure.description: Two days of standardized, pre-packaged meals were provided prior to the 10-hour fast required before blood collection. To assess how consumption of a meal would affect levels of plasma PCSK9, following each of the fasting blood draws, participants were asked to consume a high fat meal (heavy whipping cream + vanilla ice cream in a 1:4 ratio [dose = 162 g/m^2]) within 20 minutes. For the duration of the test, participants were to remain seated or recumbent until blood samples were drawn 4 h after meal completion. The mean reported was an adjusted mean (defined in first outcome measure).
measure.population: Only participants with complete PCSK9 data were included.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Publications should include input from the investigator(s), and Sponsor personnel. Such input should be reflected in publication authorship. The Sponsor must have the opportunity to review all proposed abstracts, manuscripts, or presentations regarding this study 60 days prior to submission for publication/presentation. Any information identified by the Sponsor as confidential must be deleted prior to submission. Sponsor review can be expedited to meet publication guidelines.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Senior Vice President, Global Clinical Development
